div.p: Greetings. As soon as you recommended me to Mr. Hochholtzer and indeed to Mr. Haller, I want you to know that shortly before my arrival at the Aargau school, a certain young prefect from Basel [Lienhard Meyer?] was appointed. Therefore, having set out for Bern, I was recommended to the magistrate by the brothers. The magistrate, moreover, promised to look out for me at the first opportunity; Mr. Haller, however, undertook to send my letter of appointment to you. Therefore, I ask you, my lord, to add this to your other favors towards me: if the letters reach you, please ensure they are delivered to either Bischofszell or Konstanz to my brother Lütfrid Jung.

May the Lord preserve both you and your church along with your family in His peace. These few words to you for now from the journey; otherwise, I hope there will be an opportunity to write more extensively. Farewell.
To the illustrious Antistes of the Zürich church, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his most esteemed lord.
